entities.description: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, responsible for the NSDUH data collection.
Coronavirus disease 2019, impacted NSDUH data collection in 2020.
Substance Use Disorder, a focus area within the NSDUH survey.
The 5th edition of Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, used for SUD criteria.
A new metric added to the survey in Quarter 4 of 2020 to measure COVID-19 related healthcare visits.
A method of NSDUH data collection using various modes like web or in-person.
Metrics used to decide the feasibility of in-person data collection during the COVID-19 pandemic.

relationships.description: The impact of COVID-19 on the suspension of in-person data collection for NSDUH in 2020.
Updates to SUD questions to be consistent with DSM-5 criteria for SUD in the NSDUH survey.
Inclusion of new questions to measure virtual healthcare visits related to COVID-19.
The criteria for continuing in-person data collection based on county-level and state-level COVID-19 metrics.
The use of multimode data collection procedures for the entire 2021 NSDUH survey.
